cyclone.name: JOSE
cyclone.current_location: about 715 mi (1150 km) east of the Lesser Antilles
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest, then turning northwest toward the northern Leeward Islands and just north of the Virgin Islands early this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Closest approach to the northern Leeward Islands (Antigua–Barbuda area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Antigua & Barbuda; Tropical Storm Watch: Anguilla, Montserrat, St. Kitts & Nevis, Saba, St. Eustatius
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands and U.S./British Virgin Islands, including St. Croix
weather_observation.wind: Up to tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) possible Saturday night with a 26% cumulative probability; low (7%) chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected above 3 ft, minor coastal run-up and dangerous rip currents possible.
weather_observation.rainfall: Rain totals of 2–6 inches possible; localized amounts near 4 inches could occur on St. Croix late Saturday–Sunday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large, long-period swells producing high surf and rip currents beginning Saturday.
